current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To expand and improve care provided to veterans and members of the Armed Forces with mental health
			 disorders or at risk of suicide, to review the terms or characterization
			 of the discharge or separation of certain individuals from the Armed
			 Forces, to require a pilot program on loan repayment for psychiatrists who
			 agree to serve in the Veterans Health Administration of the Department of
			 Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Extension of eligibility for domiciliary care for certain veterans who served in a theater of
			 combat operations

Review of characterization or terms of discharge from the Armed Forces of individuals with mental
			 health disorders alleged to affect terms of discharge

text.#text:
The Secretaries of the military departments shall each provide for a process by which a covered
			 individual may challenge the  terms or
		characterization of the individual's discharge or separation from the Armed
		Forces.
For purposes of this section, a covered individual is any individual as follows:
An individual who was discharged or separated from the Armed Forces for a personality disorder.
An individual who—

was discharged or separated from the Armed Forces on a punitive basis, or under
			 other than honorable conditions; and

who alleges that the basis for such
			 discharge or separation was a mental health injury or disorder incurred or
			 aggravated by the individual during service in the Armed Forces.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
through boards for the correction of military records of the military
			 department concerned.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: The Secretary of a military department shall carry out the process required by

header.#text: Discharge of process through boards of corrections of records

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the Secretary of
		the military department concerned shall instruct boards to give due
		consideration to any mental health injury or disorder determined to
			 have been incurred or aggravated by the individual during service in the
			 Armed Forces
			 and to what bearing such
		injury or disorder  may have had on the circumstances surrounding the individual's
		discharge or separation from the Armed Forces.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
In deciding
		whether to modify the terms or characterization of an individual's discharge or
		separation pursuant to the process required by

header.#text: Considerations on modification of terms of discharge or separation

Improvement of mental health care provided by Department of Veterans Affairs and Department of
			 Defense
Evaluations of mental health care and suicide prevention programs

text.#text:
Not less frequently than once each year, the Secretary concerned shall provide for the conduct of
			 an evaluation of the mental health care
			 and suicide prevention programs carried out under the laws administered by
			 such Secretary.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act/s:4/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: Each evaluation conducted under

use metrics that are common among and useful for practitioners in the field of mental health care
			 and suicide prevention;

identify the most effective mental health care and suicide prevention programs conducted by the
			 Secretary concerned; and

propose best practices for caring for individuals who suffer from mental health disorders or are at
			 risk of suicide.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be conducted by an independent third party
			 unaffiliated with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act/s:4/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: Each evaluation conducted under

The Secretary concerned shall train all providers of health care under the laws administered by
			 such Secretary on the following:
Recognizing if an individual is at risk of suicide.
Treating or referring for treatment an individual who is at risk of suicide.
Recognizing the symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder.

The Secretary concerned shall ensure that best practices for identifying individuals at risk of
			 suicide and providing quality mental health care are disseminated to
			 providers of health care under the laws administered by such Secretary.
In this section, the term
